title: Bomb detonated at elementary school playground
text:
A bomb reportedly detonated at an elementary school in Helena, Montana. (Picture: NBC Montana/Google Maps)

Detectives have confirmed that an improvised explosive device exploded on an elementary school playground.

Lewis and Clark County Sheriff Leo Dutton said that authorities responded to reports that a homemade bomb was discovered at the Rossiter Elementary school playground on Tuesday morning in Helena, Montana.

The sheriff’s office wrote on Facebook: ‘It detonated shortly after. Nobody was injured. Rossiter students are being evacuated and the path for children to evacuate has been cleared.’

Authorities said there was no threat made against the school before the bomb was found. It is not clear if the explosion damaged any property, or why the device was hurled into the play area.

Buses were called to take kids to the nearby Little Red School House. Police told parents to pick up their children from the school house, but authorities told people to avoid Sierra Road, which they say they have closed down.

Authorities held a press conference and said they will be sweeping the area to clear it of more possible explosive devices (Picture: Youtube)

Nearby schools are reportedly in lock down, but are not being evacuated at this time, authorities said.

Numerous law enforcement agencies are currently assisting in the investigation, including the FBI, the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms, and Explosives (ATF), and the Montana Highway Patrol.

No arrests have been made in the connection with the incident, authorities said.
description: Students at Rossiter Elementary School in Helena, Montana were evacuated from the school after an explosive device detonated.
